page.title: 10Lexham Wine
page.content: Local{industry}is represented by the wine produced at Lexham Hall vineyard. It usually is a dry white with a mild fruity flavour.But there are four types of wine.They are: Riesling - Sylvaner (Muller Thurgad),Scheurebe, Reichensteiner and Madeleine.The grapes are all green and like all wine grapes are very sour to taste.Through good{farming}the grapes hang in bunches containing between ten and fifty five grapes in each bunch.The bottles of wine are sold over a very wide area,but are available in local village shops,which is a good example of local{trade.}The production of the wine involves seasonal{employment.
